com.mygdx.game.screens

Class GameOver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mygdx.game.screens.GameOver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

    public class GameOver
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
    The Game Over screen displays the same background image as the Main Menu and allows the user to try again with the same class, choose a different class, or exit the game. The screen also shows users which level they reached and how many points they received. The screen utilizes a ton of LibGDX libraries, including Stage, Skin, and BitmapFont.
    Version:
    May 31, 2015
    Author:
    Som Pathak, Other contributors: Andrew Si, Period: 4, Assignment: my-gdx-game-core, Sources: libgdx

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameOver(Malice g, com.badlogic.gdx.audio.Music m, Player player, java.lang.String playerType)
      Creates a GameOver screen and stores the Malice object that created this screen, the music currently playing, the player object from Game Screen, and the class that the player chose.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void dispose()
      Removes the Skin, Stage, and Batch to prevent memory leakage.

      Displays the amount of points the player received and the level that the player reached.
      void resize(int width, int height)

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameOver

        public GameOver(Malice g,
        com.badlogic.gdx.audio.Music m,
        Player player,
        java.lang.String playerType)
        Creates a GameOver screen and stores the Malice object that created this screen, the music currently playing, the player object from Game Screen, and the class that the player chose.
        Parameters:
        g - the Malice object controlling the screens
        m - the music currently playing
        player - the player that the user was controlling in the Game Screen
        playerType - the class that the player chose in the CharacterSelect screen

    • Method Detail

      • show

        public void show()
        Shows the Game Over screen by displaying the background image and the three buttons the user can select. Changes the music volume and sets up the Stage and background image and buttons.
        Specified by:
        show in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
